revision.text:
{{Use British English|date=February 2013}} {{Spanish name|Monreal|Eraso}} {{Use dmy dates|date=February 2013}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Nacho Monreal | image = 1 nacho monreal 2015.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Monreal warming up with [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in 2015 | fullname = Ignacio Monreal Eraso | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1986|2|26|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Pamplona]], Spain | height = 1.78 m<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.dfb.de/datencenter/personen/nacho-monreal/spieler|title=Player profile: Nacho Monreal}}</ref> | position = [[Defender (association football)|Defender]] | currentclub = [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] | clubnumber = 18 | youthyears1 = | youthclubs1 = [[CD Pamplona|Pamplona]] | years1 = 2005–2006 | clubs1 = [[CA Osasuna B|Osasuna B]] | caps1 = 36 | goals1 = 3 | years2 = 2006–2011 | clubs2 = [[CA Osasuna|Osasuna]] | caps2 = 127 | goals2 = 3 | years3 = 2011–2013 | clubs3 = [[Málaga CF|Málaga]] | caps3 = 45 | goals3 = 1 | years4 = 2013– | clubs4 = [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] | caps4 = 177 | goals4 = 7 | nationalyears1 = 2004–2005 | nationalteam1 = [[Spain national under-19 football team|Spain U19]] | nationalcaps1 = 4 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2007–2009 | nationalteam2 = [[Spain national under-21 football team|Spain U21]] | nationalcaps2 = 9 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2009– | nationalteam3 = [[Spain national football team|Spain]] | nationalcaps3 = 22 | nationalgoals3 = 1 | club-update = 22:42, 2 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 3 June 2018 | medaltemplates = {{medalCountry|{{fb|ESP}}}} {{MedalCompetition|[[FIFA Confederations Cup]]}} {{medal|Runner-up|[[2013 FIFA Confederations Cup|2013 Brazil]]|}} }} '''Ignacio 'Nacho' Monreal Eraso''' ({{IPA-es|iɣˈnaθjo ˈnatʃo monreˈal eˈɾaso}}; born 26 February 1986) is a Spanish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|left back]] or [[Defender (association football)#Centre-back|centre back]] for {{English football updater|Arsenal}} club [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] and the [[Spain national football team|Spain national team]].
He started playing with [[CA Osasuna|Osasuna]] in 2005, going on to appear in 144 official games over the course of five [[La Liga]] seasons. In 2011 he signed with [[Málaga CF|Málaga]] and, two years later, joined [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]], winning three [[FA Cup]] trophies with the latter club.
A full international since 2009, Monreal represented [[Spain national football team|Spain]] at the [[2013 FIFA Confederations Cup|2013 Confederations Cup]] and the [[2018 FIFA World Cup|2018 World Cup]].
==Club career== ===Osasuna=== [[File:Nacho Monreal.jpg|thumb|upright|left|Monreal in action for Osasuna in 2010]] A product of [[CA Osasuna]]'s youth ranks, Monreal was born in [[Pamplona]], and made his official debut for his hometown club in an away game against [[Valencia CF]] on 22 October 2006, in a 0–1 [[La Liga]] loss.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/uk/en/report/203837/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=5739|title=Valencia 1–0 Osasuna|publisher=[[ESPN FC|ESPN Soccernet]]|date=22 October 2006|accessdate=28 October 2012|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140225195559/http://espnfc.com/uk/en/report/203837/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=5739|archivedate=25 February 2014}}</ref> He finished [[2006–07 La Liga|his first season]] with ten league appearances, adding two in [[2006–07 UEFA Champions League|the campaign]]'s [[UEFA Champions League]]; after the [[Navarre]]se's [[2006–07 UEFA Cup|relegation]] to the [[UEFA Europa League|UEFA Cup]], he appeared in four matches as the team reached the last four, being eliminated by fellow league side [[Sevilla FC]].
Monreal became first-choice in [[2007–08 La Liga|2007–08]], retaining that status in the subsequent seasons, with another youth product, [[César Azpilicueta]], being the undisputed starter in the other defensive wing.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/es/news/4194/editoriales/2013/02/02/3720629/monreal-y-azpilicueta-dos-amigos-que-vuelven-a-reunirse-en|title=Monreal y Azpilicueta, dos amigos que vuelven a reunirse en Londres|trans-title=Monreal and Azpilicueta, two friends that reunite in London|publisher=[[Goal (website)|Goal]]|first=Ben|last=Hayward|language=Spanish|date=2 February 2013|accessdate=24 August 2018}}</ref>
===Málaga=== On 10 June 2011, Monreal signed a five-year contract with [[Málaga CF]] on a [[Euro|€]]6 million transfer fee.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/2011/06/10/futbol/equipos/malaga/1307714444.html|title=Monreal jugará en el Málaga las próximas cinco temporadas|trans-title=Monreal will play with Málaga in next four seasons|newspaper=[[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]]|first=Jesús|last=Ballesteros|language=Spanish|date=10 June 2011|accessdate=28 October 2012}}</ref> In [[2011–12 La Liga|his first season]] he initially battled for first-choice status with [[Eliseu]], but ended up only missing seven games as the club finished fourth and [[2012–13 UEFA Champions League|qualified for the Champions League]] for the first time.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.malagahoy.es/deportes/Eliseu-Monreal-punales_0_674332858.html|title=Eliseu y Monreal, dos puñales menos|trans-title=Eliseu and Monreal, two daggers less|newspaper=Málaga Hoy|language=Spanish|date=26 February 2013|accessdate=20 January 2018}}</ref>
Monreal scored his only goal for the [[Andalusia]]ns on 27 January 2013, in a 3–2 away win against [[RCD Mallorca]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/uk/en/report/348320/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=5739|title=Mallorca stung by 10-man Malaga|publisher=ESPN FC|date=27 January 2013|accessdate=1 February 2013|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130131051349/http://espnfc.com/uk/en/report/348320/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=5739|archivedate=31 January 2013}}</ref>
===Arsenal=== [[File:Nacho Monreal and Florian Thauvin.jpg|thumb|Monreal marking [[Florian Thauvin]] during a Champions League match against [[Olympique de Marseille|Marseille]] in November 2013]] On 31 January 2013, Monreal joined English side [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] on a long-term contract. He was given the number 17 shirt.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/nacho-monreal-agrees-to-join-arsenal|title=Nacho Monreal agrees to join Arsenal|publisher=Arsenal F.C|date=31 January 2013|accessdate=1 February 2013}}</ref> The fee was undisclosed, but was believed by ''[[Sky Sports]]'' to be around [[Pound sterling|£]]8.5 million.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11670/8459528/Arsenal-sign-Spain-internation-left-back-Nacho-Monreal-from-Malaga|title=Arsenal sign Spain international left-back Nacho Monreal from Malaga|publisher=Sky Sports|date=1 February 2013|accessdate=24 August 2018}}</ref> He made his [[Premier League]] debut against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] two days later in a 1–0 home win.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-ie/news/3941/england/2013/02/02/3721101/team-news-monreal-handed-start-on-arsenal-debut-against|title=Team news: Monreal handed start on Arsenal debut against Stoke City|publisher=Goal|date=2 February 2013|accessdate=2 February 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21209193|title=Arsenal 1–0 Stoke|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|first=Neil|last=Johnston|date=2 February 2013|accessdate=2 February 2013}}</ref>
On 23 February 2013, Monreal provided the [[Assist (football)|assist]] for fellow countryman [[Santi Cazorla]] to score the winner in a 2–1 victory over [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21482693|title=Arsenal 2–1 Aston Villa|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Mandeep|last=Sanghera|date=23 February 2013|accessdate=24 February 2013}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the Gunners on 16 March, opening the scoring in a 2–0 win at [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21724187|title=Swansea 0–2 Arsenal|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Williams|first=Aled|date=16 March 2013|accessdate=23 March 2013}}</ref>
Monreal returned from injury<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/team-news-gibbs-sagna-monreal-the-ox|title=Team news: Gibbs, Sagna, Monreal, the Ox|publisher=Arsenal F.C.|date=20 August 2013|accessdate=23 August 2013}}</ref> on 21 August 2013 to feature in Arsenal's 3–0 win at [[Fenerbahçe S.K. (football)|Fenerbahçe SK]] in the [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League|Champions League group stage play-off]], playing the last three minutes in the place of [[Theo Walcott]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.arsenal.com/match/report/1314/post/first-team/fenerbahce-0-3-arsenal-match-report|title=Fenerbahçe 0–3 Arsenal|publisher=Arsenal F.C.|date=21 August 2013|accessdate=23 August 2013}}</ref> On 26 September, he scored the deciding penalty in a [[Penalty shoot-out (association football)|shootout]] against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] to send his team into [[2013–14 Football League Cup|the fourth round]] of the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/301230/report|title=Capital One Cup third round: Arsenal win penalty shootout after 1–1 draw with WBA|publisher=[[Sky Sports]]|date=25 September 2013|accessdate=29 May 2014}}</ref>
Upon the arrival of [[Alexis Sánchez]] in the 2014 off-season, Monreal took the vacant number 18 previously worn by [[Sébastien Squillaci]]. On 23 August, he assisted [[Olivier Giroud]]'s late equalizer in a 2–2 draw against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/aug/23/everton-arsenal-premier-league-match-report|title=Olivier Giroud rescues a point after Arsenal show backbone at Everton|newspaper=[[The Observer]]|first=Paul|last=Wilson|date=23 August 2014|accessdate=24 August 2018}}</ref> Additionally, an injury crisis in the squad saw him being deployed in an unfamiliar [[Defender (association football)#Centre-back|central defender]] role in a string of games, after [[Laurent Koscielny]] was put out of action due to an [[Achilles tendon]] injury.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/541323/Arsenal-Arsene-Wenger-Nacho-Monreal-centre-back-football-news|title=Arsene Wenger rules out move for centre-back... says he's happy with Nacho Monreal|newspaper=[[Daily Express]]|first=Simon|last=Yeend|date=29 November 2013|accessdate=14 January 2015}}</ref>
On 9 March 2015, Monreal scored the opening goal in a 2–1 win over [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] at [[Old Trafford]] that [[2014–15 FA Cup#Sixth Round Proper|put Arsenal through]] to the semi-finals of the [[FA Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/31689011|title=Manchester United 1–2 Arsenal|publisher=BBC Sport|last1=McNulty|first1=Phil|date=9 March 2015|accessdate=10 March 2015}}</ref> He played the full 90 minutes in [[2015 FA Cup Final|the final]], a 4–0 defeat of Aston Villa at [[Wembley Stadium]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/32856754|title=Arsenal 4–0 Aston Villa|publisher=BBC Sport|last1=McNulty|first1=Phil|date=30 May 2015|accessdate=30 May 2015}}</ref>
On 19 January 2016, Monreal signed a new long-term contract with Arsenal.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/20160118/monreal-signs-new-long-term-contract|title=Monreal signs new long-term contract|publisher=Arsenal F.C.|first=Max|last=Jones|date=19 January 2016|accessdate=24 August 2018}}</ref> On 23 April 2017, he scored the vital equalizer as his team came from behind to defeat [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] in the [[2016–17 FA Cup|FA Cup semi-final]] at Wembley.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2017/apr/23/arsenal-v-manchester-city-fa-cup-semi-final-live|title=Arsenal 2–1 Manchester City: FA Cup semi-final – as it happened|newspaper=[[The Guardian]]|first=Jacob|last=Steinberg|date=23 April 2017|accessdate=1 May 2017}}</ref>
On 6 November 2017, after good performances on the left side of a three-man defence,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/premier-league-5-big-talking-points-arsenal-4-3-leicester|title=Premier League: 5 big talking points from Arsenal 4–3 Leicester|publisher=[[FourFourTwo]]|first=Joe|last=Brewin|date=11 August 2017|accessdate=22 November 2017}}</ref> Monreal won the [[Professional Footballers' Association]] Player of the Month award for October of that year.<ref name="PFA">{{cite web|url=https://www.thepfa.com/news/2017/11/6/pfa-premier-league-fans-player-of-the-month-nacho-monreal|title=Nacho Monreal wins October's PFA Bristol Street Motors Fans' Player of the Month|publisher=[[Professional Footballers' Association]]|date=6 November 2017|accessdate=22 November 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171201044001/https://www.thepfa.com/news/2017/11/6/pfa-premier-league-fans-player-of-the-month-nacho-monreal|archivedate=1 December 2017}}</ref> The following 20 January, he netted once and made two assists before retiring injured 30 minutes into an eventual 4–1 home win against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/club/arsenal/359/blog/post/3354818/nacho-monreal-creative-cameo-sets-up-emphatic-arsenal-win-vs-crystal-palace|title=Monreal's creative cameo sets up emphatic Arsenal win vs. Palace|publisher=ESPN FC|first=Andrew|last=Mangan|date=20 January 2018|accessdate=20 January 2018}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:Spain - Chile - 10-09-2013 - Geneva - Eduardo Vargas, Ignacio Monreal and Andres Iniesta.jpg|thumb|left|Monreal taking on [[Chile national football team|Chile]]'s [[Eduardo Vargas]] in a 2013 friendly]] In 2007, Monreal earned his first call for the [[Spain national under-21 football team|Spain under-21 team]]. He started all their matches in the [[2009 UEFA European Under-21 Championship|2009 UEFA European Championship]], in an eventual group stage exit.
On 6 August 2009, Monreal was selected to the [[Spain national football team|senior side]] for the first time, for an [[exhibition game]] with [[Macedonia national football team|Macedonia]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.as.com/futbol/articulo/monreal-oportunidad-algo-magico/20090806dasdasftb_30/Tes|title=Monreal: "Esta oportunidad es algo mágico para mí"|trans-title=Monreal: "This is a magical opportunity for me"|newspaper=[[Diario AS]]|language=Spanish|date=6 August 2009|accessdate=28 October 2012}}</ref> He played the last 15 minutes for [[Joan Capdevila]] in a 3–2 away success;<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.europapress.es/deportes/futbol-00162/noticia-futbol-seleccion-cronica-macedonia-espana-20090812233357.html|title=Crónica del Macedonia-España: 2–3.|trans-title=Macedonia-Spain match report: 2–3.|publisher=[[Europa Press (news agency)|Europa Press]]|language=Spanish|date=12 August 2009|accessdate=15 April 2014}}</ref> on 7 September 2010, in the nation's second game after they won the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]] in [[South Africa]], he played the entire 1–4 friendly loss to [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.europapress.es/deportes/futbol-00162/noticia-futbol-seleccion-cronica-argentina-espana-20100908000609.html|title=Crónica del Argentina – España, 4–1|trans-title=Argentina – Spain match report, 4–1|publisher=Europa Press|language=Spanish|date=8 September 2010|accessdate=15 April 2014}}</ref>
Monreal was a member of the Spanish squad which reached the final of the [[2013 FIFA Confederations Cup]] in Brazil, although he was second-choice left back behind [[FC Barcelona]]'s [[Jordi Alba]]. He started in the last two group games, beginning with a 10–0 win over [[Tahiti national football team|Tahiti]] at the [[Maracanã Stadium|Maracanã]] in which he set up a [[David Villa]] goal.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22896367|title=Spain 10–0 Tahiti|publisher=BBC Sport|last1=Magowan|first1=Alistair|date=20 June 2013|accessdate=19 January 2015}}</ref>
Monreal scored his first goal for Spain on 12 November 2016, contributing to a 4–0 defeat of Macedonia for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)|2018 World Cup qualifiers]] in [[Granada]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/en/football/spanish-football/2016/11/12/58278dc046163f296f8b45b2.html|title=Spain march past Macedonia|newspaper=Marca|first=Arch|last=Bell|location=Madrid|date=12 November 2016|accessdate=24 August 2018}}</ref> He was then selected by manager [[Julen Lopetegui]] for the finals in Russia.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/morata-misses-out-on-spain-world-cup-squad/1ub1qz7jod09i1lfvdcy84ea2l|title=Morata misses out on Spain's 23-man World Cup squad|publisher=Goal|first=Tom|last=Maston|date=21 May 2018|accessdate=21 May 2018}}</ref>
